channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Dislodged duct at Nex: 5 unanswered questions
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

On Sunday, an air-conditioning ventilation duct came crashing down from the ceiling of a Shaw Theatres cinema hall in Nex mall and landed on cinemagoers, injuring two of them.

item.title: Doctor involved in HIV data leak struck off medical register
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Ler Teck Siang, the doctor involved in the HIV registry data leak in January last year, has been removed from the medical register, the Singapore Medical Council's (SMC) disciplinary tribunal said in its grounds of decision released on Tuesday.

item.title: Bedok murders: Maid hit man with stool and stomped on wife
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

An Indonesian maid who killed an elderly couple in 2017 claimed she wanted only to run away, and that the double murders happened during a scuffle.

item.title: Zouk Group eyes global expansion in wake of buyout
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore-based Zouk Group is forging ahead with global expansion plans, even as it faces a challenging business environment and a future without the backing of the Genting group.

item.title: Owners responsible for upkeep of buildings, says BCA
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

The maintenance of air-conditioning mechanical ventilation (ACMV) ducts within buildings is not subject to regulatory requirements, said the Building and Construction Authority (BCA) in a statement yesterday.

item.title: AI tool developed to detect abnormal chest X-rays quickly
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

An artificial intelligence-powered tool has been developed to detect abnormal chest X-rays quickly during Covid-19 screening at the National Centre for Infectious Diseases (NCID).

item.title: S'pore, South Korea set up fast lane for essential travel
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore and South Korea have concluded a fast-lane arrangement which will allow for essential business and official travel between the two countries from tomorrow.

item.title: State Courts apologise to man jailed two extra days due to officer's error
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

The State Courts have apologised to a lorry driver after he spent an extra two days in jail because his payment for a fine was not recorded.

item.title: Man charged over Lucky Plaza car crash that killed two maids
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

A 64-year-old man was charged yesterday over the Lucky Plaza crash that killed two domestic helpers last December.

item.title: Rail subsidies rise as reliability goes up
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Higher rail reliability has come at a substantial cost, with taxpayers having to subsidise rail operations by nearly $600 million last year.

item.title: Workers enjoy afternoon out in parks after months in dorms
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

After months of being cooped up in their dormitories, some 50 foreign workers had the chance to stretch their legs in Labrador Park and HortPark yesterday afternoon, as part of a trial run to allow more healthy workers out of their dormitories on rest days.

item.title: SPH Chinese Media Group, business groups help lift heartland businesses
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Hawkers and neighbourhood enterprises will get a helping hand to boost their businesses, thanks to a collaboration between the Singapore Press Holdings' Chinese Media Group (CMG) and two business associations.

item.title: Three new clusters at dorms; 49 new cases reported
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Three new coronavirus clusters in worker dormitories were announced by the Ministry of Health (MOH) yesterday.

item.title: NUS holds 25th spot as NTU rises to 47th in global ranking
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

The National University of Singapore retained its position as the world's 25th top university and Asia's third best, according to the Times Higher Education rankings released yesterday.

item.title: NEA to keep up fight against dengue despite fall in cases
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Despite some success in fighting dengue, the National Environment Agency (NEA) yesterday said it is sustaining its efforts to keep the current outbreak under control.

item.title: More avenues for special education teachers to progress
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Teachers in special education (Sped) schools will have more room to progress in their careers, through two new tracks in teaching and leadership.

item.title: Charity rolls out free Wi-Fi access at void deck for Kebun Baru residents
item.description:
September 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Madam Siti Aidah Abdullah's children, aged 17 and 15, used to spend hours doing their homework at a McDonald's outlet in Ang Mo Kio because of the free Wi-Fi.
